perturbation.original_text:
MSL expressly warrants that all Products, MSL supplied materials and Parts, and work prepared for IBM will conform in all material respects to the specifications, drawings, or other descriptions furnished or adopted by IBM, and will be of specified quality, good workmanship, and free from defect subject to the following terms:
i) MSL's warranty for IBM Designated Parts will be as long as, and will be on the same terms and conditions as the Parts supplier's warranty stated in the relevant purchasing contract.
ii) MSL will not provide a warranty for IBM Parts. However, MSL will provide Failure Analysis for such parts. MSL will process such failed Parts as "Return to MSL for credit to IBM" in a timely manner.
iii) MSL will not provide a warranty for consigned Products. However, MSL will provide failure analysis for such Products. MSL will process such failed Products per IBM's instruction in a timely manor.
iv) MSL will warrant all MSL Procured Parts for [*] months unless otherwise stated in the applicable Product Attachment, or agreed to by IBM in writing.
v) MSL will warrant its workmanship for [*] months unless other stated in the applicable Product Attachment.
perturbation.changed_text:
MSL warrants that all Products, MSL supplied materials and Parts, and work prepared for IBM will conform to the specifications, drawings, or other descriptions furnished or adopted by IBM, and will be of specified quality and good workmanship subject to the following terms:
i) MSL's warranty for MSL Procured Parts may be limited as stated in the applicable Product Attachment, or as agreed to by IBM in writing.
v) MSL's workmanship may have limited warranty as stated in the applicable Product Attachment.
perturbation.explanation: The original text warrants that all Products, materials and parts meet specifications. The modified text weakens this warranty by stating it is only a simple warranty that depends on the company. This introduces a legal risk as it could be interpreted to circumvent implied warranty obligations, which is non-compliant under California Commercial Code ยง2314.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Commercial Code ยง2314 (Implied Warranty of Merchantability)

perturbation.original_text:
MSL will be responsible for the service and support of any asset transferred from IBM ownership to MSL. System or end user software or requests for version upgrades will be under separate agreement.
f) MSL will transmit reports and data files as IBM requires for history, audit, validation, and measurements as defined in Appendix 3.
g) MSL will provide the necessary capability to accommodate non AAS/GEMS orders and provide confirmation/status information as required.
h) Except as otherwise provided herein, MSL will obtain the systems , applications, and licenses they deem necessary by their own means.
i) MSL agrees to have all MSL applications Year 2000 compliant prior to migrating any IBM data into it's applications or data bases.
perturbation.changed_text:
MSL will be responsible for the service and support of any asset transferred from IBM ownership to MSL. System or end user software or requests for version upgrades will be under separate agreement.
f) MSL will transmit reports and data files as IBM requires for history, audit, validation, and measurements as defined in Appendix 3.
g) MSL will provide the confirmation/status information as required.
h) Except as otherwise provided herein, MSL will obtain the systems , applications, and licenses they deem necessary by their own means.
i) MSL agrees to use commercially reasonable efforts to comply with the requirements for MSL applications.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of 'provide the necessary capability to accommodate non AAS/GEMS orders' reduces MSL's obligation to fulfill diverse order types. The removal of 'Year 2000 compliant' is now obsolete and creates legal risk, as systems may not function properly and create liabilities.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied warranty of fitness for a particular purpose.

perturbation.original_text:
a) A defective FRU shall be a FRU that does not conform in all material respects to that Product's particular specifications.
b) IBM will return defective FRUs that are under warranty to MSL freight collect. MSL will perform Failure Analysis and incoming inspection and testing as described in the applicable Product Attachment for FRU's rejected or returned to MSL which are still under warranty. If the rejected FRU passes all inspection and test criteria, the FRU shall be classified as NDF and such FRU shall be returned to IBM freight collect.
perturbation.changed_text:
a) A defective FRU shall be a FRU that does not conform to that Product's particular specifications.
b) IBM may return defective FRUs to MSL and the acceptance is at the sole discretion of MSL. MSL may perform Failure Analysis and incoming inspection and testing as described in the applicable Product Attachment for FRU's rejected or returned to MSL which may still be under warranty. If MSL accepts the item for inspection and testing, and if the rejected FRU passes all inspection and test criteria, the FRU shall be returned to IBM.
perturbation.explanation: The original requires all defective FRUs under warranty be returned to MSL. The modified text changes this to allow MSL sole discretion over acceptance and removing MSL's obligation. This significantly weakens consumer rights concerning warranty and may introduce a legal risk. This violates California's implied warranty laws by limiting the avenue available for defective items. By being able to refuse acceptance, the contract avoids the responsibilities placed on them by CA law.
